Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, slightly ribbed, fabric grey in section, interior caked with a thick resinous substance, with remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing part of a letter.
Curator's comments: This is the conclusion, it seems, of the text on 1923,0327.54 (BM. 55787), though written on the left side of it.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.88)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87590) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87590)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 91 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
